Trial_Design.evidence: One hundred seventy-four postmenopausal women randomly received 17 β -estradiol or placebo in a double-blind manner

Objective.evidence: we evaluated the influence of early postoperative neurocognitive dysfunction on quality of life in postmenopausal women undergoing cardiac surgery and whether it is impacted by perioperative 17 β -estradiol treatment

Method_Outcome.evidence: Quality of life was assessed at baseline and 6 mo after surgery with the SF-36 questionnaire and the Lawton instrumental activities of daily living scale

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomly received 17 β -estradiol or placebo in a double-blind manner

Number_Analysed.evidence: Complete data were available from 108 women

Result_Outcome.evidence: a neurocognitive deficit 4 to 6 wk after surgery was an independent predictor of a lower SF-36 physical component score ( P = 0.004) and lower Lawton instrumental activities of daily living scale 6 mo postoperatively ( P = 0.026)
